author: Katie Dangerfield
title: University of Winnipeg waives fees for applicants under U.S. travel ban - Winnipeg | Globalnews.ca
text:
February 14, 2017 10:09 am Updated: February 14, 2017 10:12 am University of Winnipeg waives fees for applicants under U.S. travel ban By Katie Dangerfield Online Producer Global News 
WATCH: President Trump's travel ban sparks panic abroad, lawsuits. What is this? 
Sponsored content is written by Global News' editorial staff without any editorial influence by the sponsor. If you'd like to learn more... X What is this? 
Sponsored content is written by Global News' without any editorial influence by the sponsor. If you'd like to learn more... - Listen 
WINNIPEG — The University of Winnipeg is waiving fees for prospective students from countries affected by the United States travel ban . 
The university if covering the $110 international application fee for students from any of the seven, predominately Muslim countries. This includes students from Iran, Iraq, Libya, Somalia, Sudan, Syria and Yemen. 
RELATED: Airbnb to provide free housing to those stranded by Donald Trump’s travel ban 
In January, President Donald Trump put a four-month hold on allowing refugees into the U.S. and temporarily barred travelers from Syria and six other countries. 
“Like other Canadian universities, we value the diversity and talent our international students bring to campus and recognize the travel ban is causing uncertainty and anxiety to students from those affected countries,” states officials from the University of Winnipeg on a media release. 
“Our goal is to help alleviate that stress and ensure students from all parts of the globe know they are welcome in Canada and at The University of Winnipeg.” © 2017 Global News, a division of Corus Entertainment Inc.
